intro: Canscorinella stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scrophularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of tubular flowers, typically in shades of pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Canscorinella stricta is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local biodiversity and ecological balance.
